action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant on the side table, the book in the refrigerator and the plate on the shelf.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a table and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.
You can't see a shelf here.
You are in a pantry now. There are a refrigerator and a freezer. The refrigerator is closed. The freezer is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a sandwich, a orange, a peach, a apple and a banana.
You can't see a book here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a table and a cupboard. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
You can't see a book here.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a chair and a book. The book is on the table. There are passages to a hallway, a kitchen and a bedroom here.
You can't see a table here.
You can't see a table here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a table and a cupboard. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
You can't see a book here.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a chair and a book. The book is on the table. There are passages to a hallway, a kitchen and a bedroom here.
You can't see a table here.
> go to the side of the room
I don't know what you mean.
You can't see a table here.
You can't see a table here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a table and a cupboard. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
You can't see a book here.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a chair and a book. The book is on the table. There are passages to a hallway, a kitchen and a bedroom here.
You can't see a table here.
> go to the counter in the kitchen
I don't know what you mean.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a table and a cupboard. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
You can't see a book here.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a chair and a book. The book is on the table. There are passages to a hallway, a kitchen and a bedroom here.
You can't see a table here.
You can't see a table here.
> go to the table in the kitchen
I don't know what you mean.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a table and a cupboard. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.

You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a chair and a book. The book is on the table. There are passages to a hallway, a kitchen and a bedroom here.
You can't see a table here.
> go to the kitchen and take the book from the table
I don't know what you mean.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a table and a cupboard. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a chair and a book. The book is on the table. There are passages to a hallway, a kitchen and a bedroom here.
